answers.answer: You have already been told that your blood work shows that you are not infected with Hep B.If you have some other issue that you're overlooking we wouldn't know.  We have Hep B and this is a support community for people with Hep B.You might go to the STD community where they might be able to answer your questions related to your sexual encounter.  Good luck.

"loose stools, episcleritis (inflammation of the white part of the eye), and pain on my right side"Check with your doctor about those things.There is an off chance that it could be something to do with diabetes.Make sure you get a blood sugar test.But talk to the doctor...I don't think the eye part and the pain/loose stools have ANYTHING to do with sex.OR Hepatitis.Much luck.

question: SUP? Does hepB come along with any symptoms like really loose stools, episcleritis (inflammation of the white part of the eye), and pain on my right side.  My test results both show antibodys and antigen to hepB both (-) at 6 months after exposure but im still kind of nervous why i have these symptoms...... You think they could be something else, im totally overlooking? It was my first time ever having sex, so what is the chances of getting hepB anyways in the US? Isnt it very uncommon? thanks
title: HEPB Symptoms....
